section_title: Variables and Data Types in Python
section_description: This section provides hands-on experience with Python variables and core data types. Students will practice declaring variables, manipulating different data types, and converting between types through structured exercises and real-world coding scenarios.
learning_objectives: Declare and assign variables using valid Python syntax
Distinguish between integer, float, string, and boolean data types
Perform explicit and implicit type conversion operations
Manipulate strings using concatenation, formatting, and built-in methods
Implement type hints for improved code clarity and validation

lessons.lesson_objective: Students will be able to declare variables and perform basic operations using integers, floats, and strings

exercises.exercise_instructions: Create variables to store personal information (name, age, height in meters). Print each variable with a descriptive label.
Declare two numeric variables and perform addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division operations. Display the results with formatted output.

lessons.lesson_objective: Students will demonstrate proficiency in string operations and formatting techniques
key_topics: Common string methods (upper(), lower(), split(), etc.)

exercises.exercise_instructions: Create a program that combines user input with string methods to generate a formatted message containing their name in uppercase and birth year extracted from a full date string.
Analyze a sample text string by counting characters, splitting into words, and creating a reversed version using slicing.

lessons.lesson_objective: Students will implement boolean logic and perform type conversion between primitive data types

exercises.exercise_instructions: Write code that converts user-provided string inputs to numeric types and handles invalid conversions using try-except blocks.
Create a function that accepts a variable and returns its data type as a string, then test with different data type inputs.

lessons.lesson_objective: Students will create and manipulate composite data types including lists and dictionaries

exercises.exercise_instructions: Implement a program that maintains a list of grocery items, allowing users to add, remove, and display items by index.
Create a dictionary to store personal contact details (name, phone, email) and demonstrate adding/modifying entries and accessing specific values.

lessons.lesson_objective: Students will apply type hints to functions and validate type consistency in code

exercises.exercise_instructions: Rewrite a basic calculator function with type hints for inputs and return values, then validate it using mypy.
Create a function that processes temperature data with type hints, and handles invalid inputs using type checks.
